page.title: 03North Luffenham Village
page.content: The school childrens' survey showed that there are 207 dwellings.There are 62 detached,40 bungalows,50 semi-detached,35 link/terrace and 20 converted barns etc. Of these 105 were built before 1939. Most gardens are lawned or ornamental with 25 devoted entirely to fruit and vegetables, though many people grow these on allotments. The village has an Anglican Church, a Methodist Church, a primary school,a playgroup, a post office/general store,a hairdressers,2 public houses and a woodyard.There are 4 working farms in the village. Activities in the village are Red Cross,bowls,cricket,retired peoples' club.
